alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Jasper (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 9:20PM CDT until August 02 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Crawford County in east central Illinois... Northern Jasper County in southeastern Illinois... * Until 115 AM CDT. * At 919 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oblong, Willow Hill, Hunt City, Stoy, Rose Hill, Sam Parr State Park and Gila. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
